message_1: A radioactive sample has an initial mass of 200 grams and has a half-life of 10 days. After 30 days, what is the mass of the sample remaining?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we'll use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 200 grams, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 30 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 200 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)

Final mass = 200 * (1/2)^3

Final mass = 200 * (1/8)

Final mass = 25 grams

So after 30 days, the mass of the radioactive sample remaining is 25 grams.
